title: 109_hr5193
content: CONTINUITY OF MEDICARE PRESCRIPTION DRUG COVERAGE FOR FULL-BENEFIT DUAL ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS. Continuation of Medicare coverage for certain prescriptions for full-benefit dual eligible individuals under Section 1860D-2(a) of the Social Security Act. This amendment ensures that qualified prescription drug coverage includes coverage for a covered part D drug for full-benefit dual eligible individuals unless deemed medically unnecessary by a prescribing physician. The amendment ensures that prescription drug coverage includes a covered part D drug for full-benefit dual eligible individuals unless deemed medically unnecessary by a physician. The effective date of the amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. The amendment allows Medicare prescription drug coverage to include benzodiazepines. State Medicaid programs can now cover Medicare prescription drug copayments for full-benefit dual eligible individuals. The amendment allows states to provide Medicaid coverage for Medicare prescription drug cost-sharing for full-benefit dual eligible individuals. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows Medicaid coverage for Medicare prescription drug cost-sharing for full-benefit dual eligible individuals, without excluding drugs prescribed for off-label uses. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows Medicaid coverage for Medicare prescription drug cost-sharing for full-benefit dual eligible individuals, even for off-label uses not included in standard clinical reference compendia. Effective as if included in the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. Authorization for the Secretary of Health and Human Services to waive denial of prescription drug coverage. The amendment allows individuals to apply for a waiver from the Secretary to require prescription drug coverage after exhausting all other options. The waiver can be granted if the prescribing physician certifies the necessity of the drug. The amendment requires a physician to certify the medical necessity of a prescription drug for an individual. Effective as if included in the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. SEC. 6. Holding pharmacies harmless for certain costs incurred during implementation of Medicare Part D. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will provide payments to pharmacies to fully reimburse them for transaction fees and technology upgrades related to identifying and enrolling full-benefit dual eligible individuals in Medicare prescription drug coverage under Part D of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Payments will be made to pharmacies to reimburse them for transaction fees and technology upgrades related to enrolling full-benefit dual eligible individuals in Medicare prescription drug coverage. The payments will cover costs incurred between December 1, 2005, and June 1, 2006, and will be made from the Medicare Prescription Drug Account.
